title: Voice Chat Rooms
body:
Why can't League of Legends have in-game voice chat? This question has probably been asked a million times but always receives the same answer:

 League is too toxic to have in-game voice chat and doing so would only make it worse. 

Now, what if we thought of a solution to this? I have an idea, **Voice Chat Rooms**
Like normal chat rooms except everyone can talk to each other via mic and also includes a mute/unmute button for each member in the group.

Now, how does this remove the problem?
Only people on your friends list can be invited to **Voice Chat Rooms** and you must of been friends for at least **24 hours** ; this removes the likelihood of some random toxic kid adding you after a match and inviting you to his **Voice Chat Room**  just to tell you how bad you are. Plus if anyone starts to be toxic in the first place the mute button is always there.

So, what does everyone think? I'm open to all ideas if anyone can think of something better

replies.body:
>Plus if anyone starts to be toxic in the first place the mute button is always there.

Yes because people use the mute button as it is now, and don't always come on here complaining about toxic people.

Plus there is no need for voice chat in league, because there are so many ways to have voice chat right now, Discord, Curse, Teamspeak, Skype and i'm sure there is more.
But not everyone has or wants to download these other programs so implementing it in-game makes it a lot easier to use and access

If you **want** voice chat, download the program.

implementing it in game is still not required no matter what you say.

Riot doesn't **want** to implement voice chat.

Those who want voice chat download these programs. Those that don't just use the league client. Why force this on all league users?

I enjoy listenning to music while playing, I dont want to have to download extra bytes the next patch upgrade because you were too lazy to google "Discord"

I've been really reluctant to get new voice com software too but I've found Discord and TeamSpeak are actually really lightweight (compared to Skype). They don't take up much space and they do everything you want to do and more since you can go beyond the game.
